snippet: Dario Franchitti fractured two vertebrae and broke his right ankle when his car went airborne into a fence on the last lap of the Grand Prix of Houston on Sunday.
abstract: Three-time Indianapolis 500 winner Dario Franchitti fractures two vertebrae and breaks his right ankle in crash at Grand Prix of Houston; 13 fans and an IndyCar official are also injured by flying debris; other racing news noted.
lead_paragraph: Dario Franchitti fractured two vertebrae and broke his right ankle when his car went airborne into a fence on the last lap of the Grand Prix of Houston on Sunday.

headline.main: Franchitti and Fans Injured at the Grand Prix of Houston
